Event.Maindescription:
‘Siva Sukhap Peruvellam’ is an inspired Tamil translation of ‘Shivanandalahari’, a monumental work by Bhagavan Adi Sankara. This book of 100 beautiful Sanskrit verses, that adores the ‘Parabrahmam’ as the union of Shiva and Shakti, is another testimony for the mastery and the unparalleled position of Sankara, both as a poet and philosopher of the highest caliber. The main emphasis of Shivanandalahari is ‘Bhakti’ and the verses portray the perspectives of a sincere aspirant, seeking the benign grace of God.

The second book is also an inspired translation of Sankara’s ‘Sri Dakshinamurthy Stotram’. With only 10 verses, Sri Dakshinamurthy Stotram is a small book in comparison, yet is an extremely intricate work that brings out essence of entire Vedanta. Here the main emphasis is ‘Gyana’, the true knowledge about the Self and its non-duality with the Universal-Self.

These two great works of Sankara are enchanting to read and revealing when understood, which are hopefully brought out in the Tamil renderings.

The third book, Sri Adiguru Dakshinamurthy Vazhipadu, is a revised-print of an earlier work, consisting of Tamil verses and pictures of rare forms of Sri Dakshinamurthy, sketched by Smt. Jaya Chandrasekaran by the instruction of Sri Kanchi Maha Periva. As a book of prayers, it contains verses that seek the benign grace of Adiguru, for attaining perfection in all our physical, respirational, mental, intellectual and causal embodiments,

Following the blessed release of these books at Kanchi Kamakoti Mutt on 11th Sep 2014, these are to be introduced to our community in London.

All proceeds from these books are dedicated to ‘Veda samrakshana’ and charitable causes. Please do attend the function.

Mee. Rajagopalan (RSVP: rajjag@gmail.com, Ph: 0208 427 8600)
